intro: Alexa confusa, commonly known as the confused alexa, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and requires a warm, humid climate. Due to its unique appearance and ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and tropical landscapes.
